# isRunning

**Instance Property**

A status that indicates whether the receiver is still running.

## Declaration

```swift
var isRunning: Bool { get }
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the receiver is still running, otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] means either the receiver could not run or it has terminated.

## Related Documentation

- **waitUntilExit()**: Blocks the process until the receiver is finished.
- **launch()**: Launches the task represented by the receiver.
- **terminate()**: Sends a terminate signal to the receiver and all of its subtasks.

## Querying the State

- **terminationStatus**: The exit status the receiver’s executable returns.
- **terminationReason**: The reason the system terminated the task.
